blurb: Wren is a small, fast, class-based concurrent scripting language

key_features.title: Familiar
key_features.content: Wren uses a familiar, modern syntax familiar to many coming from JS or another C-like language.

key_features.title: Small
key_features.content: Wren's VM implementation is under 4,000 semicolons of readable and lovingly commented C code.

key_features.title: Fast
key_features.content: A single-pass compiler, tight byte-code, and compact objects keeps Wren fast on it's feet.

key_features.title: Concurrent
key_features.content: Lightweight fibers let you organize your program into a flock of communicating coroutines.

key_features.title: Embeddable
key_features.content: Easily embedded, no dependencies, a small standard lib, and easy-to-use C API.

key_features.title: Class-based
key_features.content: Many scripting languages lack (or have unusual) object models. Wren places classes front and center.
